name: Jason Scott - Forever Red Quiz | TV for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: When not fighting as a Power Ranger, what did Jason do for fun?
options: Baked cookies and cakes for the homeless.
questions.explanation:
Taught martial arts classes.

	From the very first episode Jason's love of martial arts shone through. He was seen teaching a class that included his fellow Ranger Billy at the Angel Grove Youth Center early in the pilot episode.

questions.text: Which Zord did Jason pilot in the first season of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers"?
questions.explanation:
Tyrannosaurus Dinozord.

	Jason, as the red Ranger, was able to pilot the red T-Rex zord. He also later had access to the Dragonzord when the green Ranger nearly lost his powers and gave his own power coin to Jason.  In the second season Jason gained access to the Red Dragon Thunderzord.

questions.text: Why did Jason give up his powers and leave the team?
questions.correct: He chose to go to a peace conference in Switzerland.
options: He graduated from high school and moved away.
He lost his power coin and the ability to morph in a fight with a monster.
questions.explanation:
He chose to go to a peace conference in Switzerland.

	In the real world, it was a contract dispute that caused the actor to leave the show.  Within the show though, Jason, along with Trini and Zack, were selected as ambassadors to a youth peace conference in Switzerland.  Jason would return on later seasons of the show and also appeared in "Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie".

questions.text: Jason was the original team leader of the Power Rangers.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He was the natural born leader among the teens that Zordon and Alpha 5 selected to become Rangers. In the real world though, the green Ranger, Tommy Oliver, was the smash hit and fan favorite. Producers only had so much to go on, but when the green Ranger went on to become the white Ranger, he was chosen to replace Jason as team leader.

questions.text: After leaving the team, Jason returned about a year later on "Power Rangers Zeo". What Ranger did he come back as?
questions.explanation:
Gold Ranger.

	Jason came back from the conference in Switzerland and quickly became a Ranger again. The gold Ranger did not draw his power from the Zeo Crystal, but from alien sources. Trey initially had the power, but had to give it up when he was having issues of his own. Jason only held the powers for a short while, later giving them up when it was discovered that the human body couldn't contain the alien power.

questions.text: During his second stint as a Ranger, what Zord did Jason pilot?
questions.explanation:
Pyramidas.

	Pyramidas was the Zord that belonged to the gold Ranger. In addition to being used to fight monsters, Pyramidas was capable of interstellar travel. When Trey took back the gold Ranger powers, he took Pyramidas back to Triforia with him.

questions.text: Jason and Kimberly dated throughout the first season of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Jason never dated any of his fellow Rangers. Kimberly (the pink Ranger) dated and fell in love with Tommy (the green/white Ranger). Jason is shown to have romantic interests in background characters from time to time, but never with a main character, Ranger or otherwise.

questions.text: Whose weightlifting record did Jason beat during the first season of "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers"?
questions.explanation:
Bulk.

	Bulk and Skull were the Angel Grove High School bullies. Bulk was a huge person, who was obviously very strong, while Skull was a scrawny person.  Bulk was very proud of his record, and bragged about it a lot during the episode where it was brought up. At the end of the episode, Bulk was embarrassed when his record fell.

questions.text: Which set of Ranger powers did Jason appear as during the "Forever Red" episode in "Power Rangers Wild Force"?
questions.explanation:
Mighty Morphin.

	Jason was brought back as the Mighty Morphin Ranger instead of Rocky, who had replaced him, for this special episode. The episode was the 10 year anniversary of the "Power Rangers" being on the air in the United States.

questions.text: Which of the following "Power Rangers" villains did Jason never battle against, as a Ranger?
questions.explanation:
Divatox.

	Jason battled Rita and later Zedd during the "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers" seasons. He battled the Machine Empire during the "Zeo" season and in the "Forever Red" episode he was in later. While he did appear on screen with Divatox, during "Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie" he was never a Ranger during that time. He was simply a friend to the Rangers.
